duties.title: Know Your Recovery Plan
duties.content:
Your Recovery Plan is located on the CIP v5 SharePoint Site http://CIP . You will be notified by your leader if you have a defined role in the Plan.

POTENTIAL ISSUES

  • Not knowing the location of the Recovery Plan.
  • Not knowing your role on the Recovery Plan if you have a defined role.

duties.title: Recover From An Incident
duties.content:
When an asset is fried to a crisp or a facility is unavailable because of a Cyber Security Incident, don't lose hope. We have a Recovery Plan to handle this. Everyone can have a part to play in recovery, so be ready to support the instructions of the Recovery Team.

For small events, you may just need to give the IT people space to do their job. An encouraging word and a drink go a long way towards reducing stress that may arise with the recovery team on these occasions.

However, for large incidents like a control center becoming unavailable, you may have a more significant contribution. Your schedule may change and you may need to work from a different location for a time.

POTENTIAL ISSUES

  • Not following the recovery plan after a crisis.
  • When oil hits the fan - running around, screaming instead of calmly following your recovery plan.

duties.title: Secure Forensic Data
duties.content:
If you're involved in a real incident, do what you reasonably can to secure data that may be useful for authorities after the incident is over.

For example, if you reported a suspicious vehicle and took a picture of the license plate, don't lose that information. If you saw strange spacecraft operating over the facility, don't lose those pictures either - no one will believe you anyways without a picture.

Try not to delete relevant emails, remove information from CRCA's, or destroy information that might be useful in an investigation.

POTENTIAL ISSUES

Not retaining records relevant to an actual incident
